metadata.name: Non-Functional Requirements (NFR) Specification
metadata.description: Comprehensive non-functional requirements template covering performance, security, reliability, scalability, usability, maintainability using industry-standard metrics and ISO 25010 quality model

content:
# Non-Functional Requirements (NFR) Specification

## Document Information

**Project:** {{PROJECT_NAME}}  
**Version:** {{VERSION}}  
**Date:** {{DATE}}  
**Author:** {{AUTHOR}}  
**Status:** {{STATUS}}  

**Quality Model:** ISO/IEC 25010  

---

## 1. Performance Requirements

### 1.1 Response Time

| Operation | 95th Percentile | 99th Percentile | Maximum | Measurement Method |
|-----------|-----------------|-----------------|---------|--------------------|
| Page Load | {{PAGE_95}}ms | {{PAGE_99}}ms | {{PAGE_MAX}}ms | Real User Monitoring |
| API GET | {{GET_95}}ms | {{GET_99}}ms | {{GET_MAX}}ms | Server-side timing |
| API POST | {{POST_95}}ms | {{POST_99}}ms | {{POST_MAX}}ms | Server-side timing |
| Database Query | {{DB_95}}ms | {{DB_99}}ms | {{DB_MAX}}ms | Query profiling |
| Search | {{SEARCH_95}}ms | {{SEARCH_99}}ms | {{SEARCH_MAX}}ms | End-to-end timing |

**NFR-P-001:** API responses must complete within {{API_RESPONSE_TIME}}ms for 95% of requests under normal load
**Verification:** Load testing with {{CONCURRENT_USERS}} concurrent users

### 1.2 Throughput

**NFR-P-002:** System must handle {{REQUESTS_PER_SECOND}} requests per second  
**NFR-P-003:** System must process {{TRANSACTIONS_PER_HOUR}} transactions per hour  
**NFR-P-004:** Batch processing must complete {{BATCH_SIZE}} records in < {{BATCH_TIME}} minutes  

**Verification:** Performance testing with production-like data volumes

### 1.3 Resource Utilization

| Resource | Normal Load | Peak Load | Maximum | Alert Threshold |
|----------|-------------|-----------|---------|----------------|
| CPU | {{CPU_NORMAL}}% | {{CPU_PEAK}}% | {{CPU_MAX}}% | {{CPU_ALERT}}% |
| Memory | {{MEM_NORMAL}}GB | {{MEM_PEAK}}GB | {{MEM_MAX}}GB | {{MEM_ALERT}}GB |
| Disk I/O | {{DISK_NORMAL}} IOPS | {{DISK_PEAK}} IOPS | {{DISK_MAX}} IOPS | {{DISK_ALERT}} IOPS |
| Network | {{NET_NORMAL}} Mbps | {{NET_PEAK}} Mbps | {{NET_MAX}} Mbps | {{NET_ALERT}} Mbps |

**NFR-P-005:** System resource utilization must not exceed {{RESOURCE_LIMIT}}% under normal load  
**Verification:** APM tools monitoring

### 1.4 Capacity

**NFR-P-006:** System must support {{MAX_CONCURRENT_USERS}} concurrent users  
**NFR-P-007:** Database must handle {{MAX_DB_CONNECTIONS}} concurrent connections  
**NFR-P-008:** Storage must accommodate {{STORAGE_CAPACITY}}TB of data  
**NFR-P-009:** System must handle {{MAX_EVENTS_PER_SEC}} events per second  

---

## 2. Security Requirements

### 2.1 Authentication

**NFR-S-001:** All users must authenticate using {{AUTH_METHOD}} (e.g., OAuth 2.0, SAML 2.0)  
**NFR-S-002:** Multi-factor authentication (MFA) required for {{MFA_ROLES}}  
**NFR-S-003:** Passwords must meet complexity: {{PASSWORD_POLICY}}  
**NFR-S-004:** Session timeout after {{SESSION_TIMEOUT}} minutes of inactivity  
**NFR-S-005:** Maximum {{LOGIN_ATTEMPTS}} failed login attempts before lockout  
**NFR-S-006:** Account lockout duration: {{LOCKOUT_DURATION}} minutes  

### 2.2 Authorization

**NFR-S-007:** Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) with minimum {{NUM_ROLES}} roles  
**NFR-S-008:** Principle of least privilege enforced  
**NFR-S-009:** Authorization checks on all API endpoints  
**NFR-S-010:** Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) for {{ABAC_RESOURCES}}  

### 2.3 Data Protection

| Data Type | In Transit | At Rest | Backup | Retention |
|-----------|------------|---------|--------|----------|
| PII | TLS {{TLS_VERSION}} | AES-{{AES_BITS}} | Encrypted | {{PII_RETENTION}} |
| Credentials | TLS {{TLS_VERSION}} | bcrypt/Argon2 | Encrypted | {{CRED_RETENTION}} |
| Financial | TLS {{TLS_VERSION}} | AES-{{AES_BITS}} | Encrypted | {{FIN_RETENTION}} |
| Health | TLS {{TLS_VERSION}} | AES-{{AES_BITS}} | Encrypted | {{HEALTH_RETENTION}} |

**NFR-S-011:** All data in transit encrypted using TLS {{TLS_VERSION}} or higher  
**NFR-S-012:** Sensitive data at rest encrypted using AES-{{AES_BITS}}  
**NFR-S-013:** Encryption keys rotated every {{KEY_ROTATION}} days  
**NFR-S-014:** Data masking for {{MASKED_FIELDS}} in logs and UI  

### 2.4 Audit & Compliance

**NFR-S-015:** All authentication attempts logged  
**NFR-S-016:** All data modifications logged with user, timestamp, before/after values  
**NFR-S-017:** Audit logs retained for {{AUDIT_RETENTION}} years  
**NFR-S-018:** Audit logs tamper-proof and immutable  
**NFR-S-019:** Compliance with {{COMPLIANCE_STANDARDS}} (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, SOC 2, PCI-DSS)  
**NFR-S-020:** Security vulnerability scans every {{SCAN_FREQUENCY}}  
**NFR-S-021:** Penetration testing {{PENTEST_FREQUENCY}}  

### 2.5 Application Security

**NFR-S-022:** Protection against OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities  
**NFR-S-023:** Input validation on all user inputs  
**NFR-S-024:** Output encoding to prevent XSS  
**NFR-S-025:** Parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection  
**NFR-S-026:** CSRF protection on all state-changing operations  
**NFR-S-027:** Content Security Policy (CSP) headers configured  
**NFR-S-028:** Rate limiting: {{RATE_LIMIT}} requests per {{RATE_WINDOW}}  

---

## 3. Reliability Requirements

### 3.1 Availability

**NFR-R-001:** System uptime: {{UPTIME_PERCENTAGE}}% (e.g., 99.9% = 8.76 hours downtime/year)  
**NFR-R-002:** Planned maintenance window: {{MAINTENANCE_WINDOW}}  
**NFR-R-003:** Maximum unplanned downtime: {{MAX_UNPLANNED_DOWNTIME}} per month  
**NFR-R-004:** Service degradation acceptable during: {{DEGRADATION_SCENARIOS}}  

**Availability Tier:** {{AVAILABILITY_TIER}} (Tier 1: 99.671%, Tier 2: 99.741%, Tier 3: 99.982%, Tier 4: 99.995%)

### 3.2 Fault Tolerance

**NFR-R-005:** No single point of failure in critical path  
**NFR-R-006:** Automatic failover within {{FAILOVER_TIME}} seconds  
**NFR-R-007:** Graceful degradation when {{DEGRADATION_TRIGGER}}  
**NFR-R-008:** Circuit breaker pattern for external service calls (threshold: {{CIRCUIT_THRESHOLD}}% errors)  
**NFR-R-009:** Retry logic with exponential backoff for transient failures  
**NFR-R-010:** Bulkhead pattern to isolate {{ISOLATED_COMPONENTS}}  

### 3.3 Recoverability

**NFR-R-011:** Recovery Time Objective (RTO): {{RTO}} hours  
**NFR-R-012:** Recovery Point Objective (RPO): {{RPO}} minutes  
**NFR-R-013:** Database backups: {{BACKUP_FREQUENCY}}  
**NFR-R-014:** Backup retention: {{BACKUP_RETENTION}}  
**NFR-R-015:** Disaster recovery site with {{DR_SYNC}} synchronization  
**NFR-R-016:** DR drill conducted {{DR_DRILL_FREQUENCY}}  
**NFR-R-017:** Point-in-time recovery supported up to {{PITR_WINDOW}} days  

### 3.4 Data Integrity

**NFR-R-018:** Zero data loss for committed transactions (ACID compliance)  
**NFR-R-019:** Data consistency checks every {{CONSISTENCY_CHECK_FREQ}}  
**NFR-R-020:** Checksums/hashes for data integrity verification  
**NFR-R-021:** Transaction rollback on failure  

---

## 4. Scalability Requirements

### 4.1 Horizontal Scalability

**NFR-SC-001:** Stateless application design for horizontal scaling  
**NFR-SC-002:** Support scaling from {{MIN_INSTANCES}} to {{MAX_INSTANCES}} instances  
**NFR-SC-003:** Auto-scaling triggers: CPU > {{CPU_SCALE_THRESHOLD}}%, Memory > {{MEM_SCALE_THRESHOLD}}%  
**NFR-SC-004:** Scale-out within {{SCALE_OUT_TIME}} minutes  
**NFR-SC-005:** Scale-in after {{SCALE_IN_DELAY}} minutes below threshold  

### 4.2 Vertical Scalability

**NFR-SC-006:** Support vertical scaling to {{MAX_CPU}} vCPUs and {{MAX_MEMORY}}GB RAM  
**NFR-SC-007:** Database supports read replicas (up to {{MAX_READ_REPLICAS}} replicas)  

### 4.3 Data Scalability

**NFR-SC-008:** Database supports {{MAX_RECORDS}} records per table  
**NFR-SC-009:** Database sharding strategy for tables exceeding {{SHARD_THRESHOLD}} records  
**NFR-SC-010:** Support {{DATA_GROWTH_RATE}}% annual data growth  
**NFR-SC-011:** Archival strategy for data older than {{ARCHIVE_AGE}}  

---

## 5. Usability Requirements

### 5.1 User Interface

**NFR-U-001:** Interface intuitive for {{USER_EXPERTISE_LEVEL}} users  
**NFR-U-002:** Task completion time: {{KEY_TASK}} in < {{TASK_TIME}} minutes  
**NFR-U-003:** Error messages user-friendly and actionable  
**NFR-U-004:** Consistent UI/UX following {{DESIGN_SYSTEM}} design system  
**NFR-U-005:** Maximum {{MAX_CLICKS}} clicks to complete {{KEY_WORKFLOW}}  

### 5.2 Accessibility

**NFR-U-006:** WCAG {{WCAG_VERSION}} Level {{WCAG_LEVEL}} compliance  
**NFR-U-007:** Keyboard navigation for all functionality  
**NFR-U-008:** Screen reader compatible  
**NFR-U-009:** Color contrast ratio: {{CONTRAST_RATIO}}:1 minimum  
**NFR-U-010:** Text resizable up to {{TEXT_RESIZE}}% without loss of functionality  
**NFR-U-011:** ARIA labels on all interactive elements  

### 5.3 Learnability

**NFR-U-012:** New users complete {{ONBOARDING_TASK}} within {{ONBOARDING_TIME}} minutes  
**NFR-U-013:** Contextual help/tooltips available  
**NFR-U-014:** Interactive tutorials for {{KEY_FEATURES}}  
**NFR-U-015:** In-app documentation searchable  

### 5.4 Internationalization (i18n)

**NFR-U-016:** Support {{NUM_LANGUAGES}} languages: {{LANGUAGES_LIST}}  
**NFR-U-017:** Support {{NUM_LOCALES}} locales for date/time/currency formatting  
**NFR-U-018:** RTL (right-to-left) language support  
**NFR-U-019:** Unicode (UTF-8) character encoding  

---

## 6. Maintainability Requirements

### 6.1 Code Quality

**NFR-M-001:** Code coverage: {{COVERAGE_THRESHOLD}}% minimum  
**NFR-M-002:** Static code analysis with {{LINTER_TOOL}} (zero critical issues)  
**NFR-M-003:** Complexity metrics: Cyclomatic complexity < {{COMPLEXITY_MAX}}  
**NFR-M-004:** Code follows {{CODING_STANDARD}} coding standards  
**NFR-M-005:** All public APIs documented with {{DOC_STANDARD}}  
**NFR-M-006:** Code review required before merge (minimum {{REVIEWERS}} reviewers)  

### 6.2 Modularity

**NFR-M-007:** Microservices architecture with {{NUM_SERVICES}} independent services  
**NFR-M-008:** Service coupling: Low coupling, high cohesion  
**NFR-M-009:** Dependency injection for testability  
**NFR-M-010:** APIs versioned (semantic versioning: MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH)  

### 6.3 Observability

**NFR-M-011:** Structured logging (JSON format) with correlation IDs  
**NFR-M-012:** Log levels: DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL  
**NFR-M-013:** Distributed tracing with {{TRACING_TOOL}} (OpenTelemetry)  
**NFR-M-014:** Metrics collection every {{METRICS_INTERVAL}} seconds  
**NFR-M-015:** Monitoring dashboards for {{KEY_METRICS}}  
**NFR-M-016:** Alerting on {{ALERT_CONDITIONS}}  
**NFR-M-017:** Log retention: {{LOG_RETENTION}} days  

### 6.4 Deployability

**NFR-M-018:** Zero-downtime deployments (blue-green or canary)  
**NFR-M-019:** Deployment time: < {{DEPLOY_TIME}} minutes  
**NFR-M-020:** Rollback capability within {{ROLLBACK_TIME}} minutes  
**NFR-M-021:** CI/CD pipeline with automated testing  
**NFR-M-022:** Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using {{IAC_TOOL}}  
**NFR-M-023:** Database migrations automated and reversible  

---

## 7. Compatibility Requirements

### 7.1 Browser Support

| Browser | Minimum Version | Support Level |
|---------|----------------|---------------|
| Chrome | {{CHROME_MIN}} | Full |
| Firefox | {{FIREFOX_MIN}} | Full |
| Safari | {{SAFARI_MIN}} | Full |
| Edge | {{EDGE_MIN}} | Full |
| IE 11 | - | Not Supported |

**NFR-C-001:** Support latest 2 major versions of all listed browsers  
**NFR-C-002:** Graceful degradation for unsupported browsers  

### 7.2 Device Support

**NFR-C-003:** Responsive design for desktop (1920x1080), tablet (1024x768), mobile (375x667)  
**NFR-C-004:** Touch-friendly interface (minimum 44x44px tap targets)  
**NFR-C-005:** iOS {{IOS_MIN}}+ support  
**NFR-C-006:** Android {{ANDROID_MIN}}+ support  

### 7.3 Integration Compatibility

**NFR-C-007:** RESTful API following OpenAPI {{OPENAPI_VERSION}} specification  
**NFR-C-008:** Backward compatibility for {{API_VERSION_SUPPORT}} API versions  
**NFR-C-009:** Webhooks for {{WEBHOOK_EVENTS}} events  
**NFR-C-010:** SSO integration with {{SSO_PROVIDERS}}  

---

## 8. Operational Requirements

### 8.1 Monitoring

**NFR-O-001:** Real-time monitoring of {{MONITORED_METRICS}}  
**NFR-O-002:** Health check endpoint responding within {{HEALTH_CHECK_TIME}}ms  
**NFR-O-003:** Synthetic monitoring from {{NUM_LOCATIONS}} geographic locations  
**NFR-O-004:** SLA compliance tracking and reporting  

### 8.2 Support

**NFR-O-005:** Support available {{SUPPORT_HOURS}}  
**NFR-O-006:** Critical issue response time: {{CRITICAL_RESPONSE}} hours  
**NFR-O-007:** High priority response time: {{HIGH_RESPONSE}} hours  
**NFR-O-008:** Support channels: {{SUPPORT_CHANNELS}}  

---

## 9. Legal & Compliance

**NFR-L-001:** GDPR compliance (data portability, right to erasure)  
**NFR-L-002:** HIPAA compliance (if handling PHI)  
**NFR-L-003:** SOC 2 Type II certification  
**NFR-L-004:** PCI-DSS compliance (if handling payment cards)  
**NFR-L-005:** Data residency: {{DATA_RESIDENCY_REGIONS}}  
**NFR-L-006:** Terms of Service and Privacy Policy displayed  
**NFR-L-007:** Cookie consent management  

---

## 10. Verification Methods

| NFR Category | Verification Method | Tools | Frequency |
|--------------|---------------------|-------|----------|
| Performance | Load/Stress Testing | {{PERF_TOOLS}} | Every release |
| Security | Penetration Testing, SAST, DAST | {{SEC_TOOLS}} | {{SEC_FREQ}} |
| Reliability | Chaos Engineering, Failover Drills | {{CHAOS_TOOLS}} | {{CHAOS_FREQ}} |
| Scalability | Load Testing, Auto-scaling Tests | {{SCALE_TOOLS}} | Every release |
| Usability | User Testing, Accessibility Audit | {{USABILITY_TOOLS}} | {{USABILITY_FREQ}} |
| Maintainability | Code Reviews, Static Analysis | {{MAINT_TOOLS}} | Every PR |
| Compatibility | Browser Testing, Device Testing | {{COMPAT_TOOLS}} | Every release |
